books.title: Some Do Not …
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: As World War I looms, a stiff English statistician and a suffragette fall in love.

books.title: Around the World in Eighty Days
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: On a bet, an eccentric Victorian gentleman races to circumnavigate the globe.

books.title: A Yankee in the Trenches
books.author: Robert Derby Holmes
books.summary: An American describes his experiences in the British Army in the First World War.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Driven Back to Eden
books.author: Edward Payson Roe
books.summary: A family leaves their crowded New York City flat to find health, happiness, and wholesome work in the countryside.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: The Second Mrs. Tanqueray
books.author: Arthur W. Pinero
books.summary: A gentleman remarries a woman of questionable character and tries to redeem her, but her past revisits the family in unexpected and tragic ways.

books.title: The House of Arden
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Two children, with the aid of a magical white mole, travel into the past in search of their family’s long-lost treasure.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: The Poisoned Chocolates Case
books.author: Anthony Berkeley
books.summary: A club of amateur sleuths attempts to solve a crime whose solution has eluded Scotland Yard.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: What Is Art?
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Leo Tolstoy outlines his philosophy of aesthetics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ameen Rihani
books.summary: A collection of Ameen Rihani’s poetry.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Mack Reynolds
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Mack Reynolds ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Hjalmar Söderberg
books.summary: A collection of Hjalmar Söderberg’s short stories, ordered by date of their translation.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
